bibl.title: Letter fragment from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, [August 7, 1900]

div1.head: Letter fragment from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, [August 7, 1900]
div1.p:
uniforms straight. (I wish I
had the $12 00/100 back I paid too
much for the suit). I can
live on my commutation,
Probably a little more,
& the salary will go in lump
to you. I must write to Ned
about the account between
us. I spoke to him about it
when at N. R. & he said
he would straighten it up,

Whether he counts it a debt
- as I thought- or a co-investment
makes no great difference
He may set It should be some-
5
No. 18. TREASURY DEPARTMENT
thing over $1000. 00/100 now, if
he count it as a debt.,

If I can find Magru-
der's letter I will enclose
it. He announces the ad-
vent of a small son;
called by my name.
Writes in a somewhat differ-
ent strain from what he did
in Jan.

I sent Dr Havard & Ran. Kean.
to Mariel in the Doser this
A. m. but it is blowing too
hard for her to come back.
& I hope they will not at -
tempt it. Went on business.
